remarks: Statement 14 in [Huneke] p. 2:  "The total number of closed walks of length p [in a friendship graph] is (k(k-1)+1)f(p)=1 (mod p)", since the number of vertices in a friendship graph is (k(k-1)+1), see ~ frgregordn0 or ~ frrusgraord , and p divides (k-1), i.e.  (k-1) mod p = 0 => k(k-1) mod p = 0 => k(k-1)+1 mod p = 1.  Since the empty graph is a friendship graph, see ~ frgra0 , as well as k-regular (for any k), see ~ 0vgrargra , but has no closed walk, see ~ clwlk0 , this theorem would be false: ` ( ( # `` ( C `` P ) ) mod P ) = 0 =/= 1 ` , so this case must be excluded.  ( (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 1-Sep-2018.)
